H0.text: Burning the tires is the best way to dispose of scrap tires, which are old, worn‑out rubber tires, for the environment.

H1.text: Dumping the tires in a lake is the best way to dispose of old, worn‑out rubber tires (scrap tires) for the environment.

H2.text: Burying the tires in a landfill is the best way of disposing of old, worn‑out rubber tires—called scrap tires—for the environment.

H3.text: Taking the tires to a recycling center is the best way to dispose of old, worn‑out rubber scrap tires for the environment.

A4.text: Tire fires can easily occur, burning for long periods, up to a month and also creating substantial pollution in the air and ground.

A5.text: The EU Landfill Directive prohibits the disposal of used tires in landfill.

A6.text: Tires are not desired at landfills, due to their large volumes and 75% void space.

A7.text: Tires can be reclaimed into, among other things, the hot melt asphalt, typically as crumb rubber modifier—recycled asphalt pavement (CRM—RAP), and as an aggregate in Portland cement concrete
